More pressing, perhaps, is my own recurring hunger, a personal affliction that needs resolution so I can focus. Economically, my primary concern is the idleness of my bakeries; despite setting wages and importing flour, they remain unstaffed and unproductive, a critical drain on resources that must be rectified. My new market stall, built on BasstheWhale's land, also needs to become an asset rather than a liability; I must quickly decide whether to operate it myself or set a rental fee, as it too will incur lease costs. Ultimately, my strategy must involve stabilizing my current ventures and then leveraging opportunities – whether from land sales or optimized businesses – to build true wealth and influence, true to the Zanchi motto, "Umbra Lucrum Invenit."
